alerts.pressure_falling_fast: Barometer falling fast ({rate} hPa/h). Prepare for deterioration.
alerts.squall_risk: High squall risk: gusts at {gustFactor}% of mean wind, pressure falling.
alerts.wind_against_tide: Wind against tide! Expect short, steep chop.

advice.light_general: Light air. Maximize sail area, keep crew weight forward.
advice.moderate_upwind: Moderate wind upwind. Good sail trim, watch your telltales.
advice.fresh_warning: Fresh wind. Take the 1st reef if not done. Reduce headsail.
advice.strong_warning: Strong wind. 2nd reef recommended. Working jib or heavily furled genoa.
advice.near_gale_warning: Near gale! Storm configuration: storm jib and deep-reefed main. Secure the deck.
advice.gale_warning: Gale force! Storm sails or bare poles. Close all hatches. Crew harnessed.
advice.pressure_dropping: Barometer falling. Deterioration likely in 6-12h. Anticipate reefing.
advice.weather_window: Favorable weather window: {hours}h of stable conditions expected.
advice.squall_preparation: Squall approaching. Take a precautionary reef. Hand ready to ease sheets.

advice.close_hauled_light: Close-hauled in light air: open the leech, ease cunningham and vang. Move crew forward.
advice.close_hauled_fresh: Close-hauled in fresh wind: tension cunningham, tighten outhaul, drop traveler to leeward.
advice.beam_reach_general: Beam reach: ease mainsheet to spreaders. Adjust vang to control twist.
advice.running_safety: Running: preventer is MANDATORY. Risk of accidental gybe.
advice.gust_preparation: Gusts at {gustFactor}% of mean wind. Keep a hand on the traveler, ready to ease.
advice.excessive_heel: Excessive heel at {heel}°! Ease the main, drop the traveler. Consider reefing.
advice.storm_config: Gale conditions: storm jib and deep-reefed main. Secure the deck. Close all hatches.
advice.keel_raise_shallow: Shallow water! Raise the keel. Draft reduced to {draftUp}m.
advice.keel_lower_offshore: Offshore: lower the keel for stability. Draft {draftDown}m.
advice.keel_lower_heavy_weather: Heavy weather: keel DOWN is MANDATORY for stability.

course.maintain: Current course is optimal, maintain heading.
course.tack: Tack now, new heading {heading}° ({cardinal}). VMG improvement {improvement} knots.
course.gybe: Gybe now, new heading {heading}° ({cardinal}). Watch the boom.

advice.low_efficiency: Performance at {efficiency}% of polar. Check sail trim.
advice.pinching: You are pinching too high. Bear away 5° for better VMG.
advice.dead_run_vmg: Dead run: sail a VMG course at {optAngle}° TWA with gybes for better progress.
advice.layline_tack: Tacking layline approaching. Tack when mark bearing reaches {heading}°.
advice.wind_shift: Wind from {cardinal} at {speed} knots. Watch for lifts to tack on the favored shift.
